heisig_chinese_memo: Think of those party streamers falling down.
heisig_story: We have taken the image of a river stream over into English to describe things that fall down in straight lines, or ripple along in lines. All of this is more than evident in the kanji given here, a pictograph of a stream.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: stream, river, river or 3-stroke river radical (no. 47)
koohiiStory1: So as not to confuse this with river (#146) think of streamers falling down.
koohiiStory2: There are three default I/O Streams in UNIX, stdin, stdout, and stderr.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The river radical and the river kanji are the same as each other!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: So, if you know the radical you know the kanji as well.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: So you're in a river. As you're floating down, enjoying yourself, you bump into something. It says "moo" to you. You look around. There are hundreds of cows („Åã„Çè) surrounding you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Touch them as you float by. Smell them. Is the river filled with cow poop? Probably. Use that to help you to remember that you run into cows when you're in the river.
Ru_Meaning: stream, river, river or three-stroke river radical (no. 47)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: whereupon („Éé) the two sticks (‰∏®) float down the river
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Think of those party streamers falling down.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The usage of " Chuan " and " Water " in Oracle bone inscriptions is very similar. For example, the inscriptions include "Bu Shui" and "Qi Shui", as well as "Bu Chuan" and "Qi Chuan". Both " water " and " chuan " are interpreted as floods here, so "no river" means "no flood". The word " Chuan " can also be used as a river god in Oracle bone inscriptions. For example, "Collection" 28180: "That is Sichuan Liao, and (there) rain", which refers to the use of Liao sacrifice method to pray for rain to the river god. The same usage is also retained in ancient documents, such as "The Analects. "Yong Ye": "The son of a plowing cow has a horn and a horn. Although you don't want to use it, the mountains and rivers give them away." Zhu Xi's note: "Mountains and rivers are the gods of mountains and rivers." " Chuan " is also used as a place name, such as "Collection" 21661: "Ding "Guicai (in) Sichuan people" refers to the return of people in Sichuan. In addition, the place name "Chuanzhi" often appears in Oracle.

" Chuan " can be used as water flow in the inscriptions. This usage is often seen in ancient books handed down, such as "The Analects. Zi Han ":" the child said in Sichuan: "lost time, day and night." "" Chuan "in inscriptions can also be used as" Quan ", read as" drains ", by means of low-lying fertile water was Ground. Yihou Suogui: "Yi (given) soil, Juechuan 200 ‚ñ°." "Ji Yun. "Jiaong Yun" says: "Dian, farmland." It is thought that the word " chuan " was later borrowed as the meaning of the field, which extended to the unit word for the field, such as Wuqi Weiding: "Ying Erchuan", which means to surround the two rivers. Land (see Huang Shengzhang). Can refer to "ÁîΩ".

In the bamboo slips and silks of the Warring States Period, the word " Chuan " used to be faked as " Shun ", as in "Cheng Zhi Wen Zhi": "A gentleman governs man and Lun (Lun) in accordance with Sichuan Tiande." It is also faked as " kun ", as in Mawangdui silk script "Sixty-four hexagrams" has the hexagram " Chuan ", which is handed down as " kun " in the Yi. Wang cited the "Shu Wen was different," says: "universe as a positive word-kun, it's as Chuan, but borrow Sichuan word." Finally, " Chuan " word also pass off as " wear " such as Changsha bullet library "Chu Book "propane article:" not Chuan ‚ñ°, quite training (cis) ", where" Chuan "read" to wear "refers through the wall, to wear things (Li Xueqin).

"Shu Wen": "The river runs through flowing water. "Yu Shu" says: "Jun „ÅèÂ∑ú, away from the river." Yan Shen „ÅèÂ∑ú water will be the river. All the gens of the river are from the river."
humanum_short_description_en: Like a river. The oracle-bone text was used as the appearance of water flow, and later the water-like part in the middle was simplified into a line.

heisig_comment:
* As a primitive, this character adds to the meaning of stream the more vivid image of a flood. Note, however, that there are certain small changes in the writing of the element, depending on where it appears relative to other elements:
on the left, it is written the same.
on the top, it is written with the three strokes more like less-then signs
on the bottom, it is written with the third stroke similar to a fishhook

Wang cited the "Shu Wen was different," says: "universe as a positive word-kun, it's as Chuan, but borrow Sichuan word." Finally, " Chuan" word also pass off as " wear" such as Changsha bullet library "Chu Book "propane article:" not Chuan ‚ñ°, quite training (cis) ", where" Chuan"read" to wear"refers through the wall, to wear things (Li Xueqin). "Shu Wen": "The river runs through flowing water. "Yu Shu" says: "Jun „ÅèÂ∑ú, away from the river." Yan Shen „ÅèÂ∑ú water will be the river. All the gens of the river are from the river."

Chuan
Basic explanation of words
Chuan
chuƒÅn
River: famous mountains and rivers. The stream is endless.
Plain, flat land: Pingchuan. Miliangchuan.
[Sichuan Capital] Travel expenses.
Specifically referring to Sichuan Province, China: Sichuan Opera. Sichuan cuisine. Chuanbei.
Chuan
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†] [chuƒÅn]
["Guangyun" Changyuan cut, Pingxian, Chang. ]
(1) River.
(2) Pingchuan, the wilderness.
(3) Road.
(4) Extended to journey. See "Sichuan Capital".
(5) Abbreviation for Sichuan Province. See "Sichuan Salt".

Radicals: Â∑ù  (river)
Meaning Mnemonic
The river radical and the river kanji are the same as each other!
So, if you know the radical you know the kanji as well.
Reading Mnemonic
So you're in a river. As you're floating down, enjoying yourself, you bump into something. It says "moo" to you. You look around. There are hundreds of cows („Åã„Çè) surrounding you.
Touch them as you float by. Smell them. Is the river filled with cow poop? Probably. Use that to help you to remember that you run into cows when you're in the river.
